Description: 14 beads made of faience in different types and colours. A: lentoid-shaped bead with incised lines forming a floral decoration on both sides. Made of light blue faience, now almost grey-black. B: 3 cylindrical segmented beads made of light blue faience, all of them broken off, very eroded. C: 1 broken cylindrical bead made of white faience. D: 1 ring-shaped bead made of white faience, slightly irregular shaped. E: 1 thicker disc-shaped bead made of white faience. F: seven disc-shaped beads, six of them made of white faience, one of them made of light blue faience, slightly varying in size and thickness.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
